title: Behind the scenes of Glastonbury's live-stream concert
description: The five-hour show stars Jorja Smith, Coldplay and Haim - all playing to a deserted Worthy Farm.

title: Amazon in pictures: Sebastião Salgado's last frontier
description: Photographer Sebastião Salgado captured images of the Amazon's forest, rivers, and tribes.

title: Eurovision: United Kingdom's hopes rest on James Newman
description: Can the Settle-born singer take home the coveted glass microphone trophy from Rotterdam?

title: Covid-19: Sewage testing ramped up in England
description: Programme to test wastewater for the virus that causes Covid now covers two-thirds of England's population.

title: Over 3,000 fans will attend the final of this year's Eurovision Song Contest
description: After being cancelled and replaced by an online 'event' last year, the competition is back on and welcoming over 3,000 fans to the live show.

title: Covid Vaccines: Could they be magnetic?
description: Videos of people sticking magnets to their arms where they claim they’ve had the Covid vaccine have gone viral. We debunk this so-called magnet challenge.

title: Water so toxic 'it could burn your eyes'
description: Martin Patience gets to the source of Lebanon's water crisis.

title: George Best: How Man Utd legend left for Dunstable Town
description: George Best was still only 28. A mercurial genius when on song for Manchester United, his next move was to Dunstable Town.

title: Five decades of Eurovision songs... from memory
description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg returns to delight you with his piano renditions and encyclopaedic knowledge of the Eurovision Song Contest.

title: George Floyd death: How US police are trying to win back trust
description: A year after George Floyd's death, it's not just civilians who'll be reflecting on what happened.

title: Timeline: Martin Bashir's actions from Diana interview to Dyson report
description: An inquiry into Martin Bashir’s interview with Princess Diana in 1995 concludes that he acted in a “deceitful” way.

title: Friends reunion to air in UK and Ireland on Sky
description: The long-awaited follow-up to the popular US sitcom will feature all six of its original stars.

title: Israel-Gaza: How children on both sides experienced the conflict
description: The BBC talks to children on both sides of the Israel-Gaza conflict about their experiences.

title: Race for top four - and everything else to look out for on final day of Premier League season
description: Qualification for the Champions League, Europa League and Europa Conference will be decided on the final day of the Premier League season.

title: Israel-Gaza: The ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas
description: What do we know about the ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas, and will it last?

title: HMS Queen Elizabeth: Why is a UK aircraft carrier going on a world tour?
description: HMS Queen Elizabeth is about to travel 26,000 miles - but is it more than a flag-waving exercise?

title: What's next for BBC after Diana report?
description: How will fallout from the the Martin Bashir inquiry affect the BBC's future?

title: Tom Cruise signed shirts help Woburn football club hit target
description: The actor signed the shirts for a local football team after filming at its ground.
